Package org.blab.utils.net

Class BlockingSocketChannel

java.lang.Object
org.blab.utils.net.BlockingSocketChannel
public class BlockingSocketChannel extends Object
BlockingSocketChannel is a wrapper for SocketChannel with message partitioning.

BlockingSocketChannel only works on messages separated by a newline character, otherwise the behaviour is undefined.

For reading purposes, implements a kind of ring buffer, which stores bytes until a terminator is encountered.

Can be passed as parameter to BlockingSocketReaders or BlockingSocketWriters to delegate read or write operations respectively. But if the channel is shared by many readers, the messages will spread uncontrollably.

  • Constructor Details

    • BlockingSocketChannel

      public BlockingSocketChannel(int cacheSize)
      Create BlockingSocketChannel with specified cache size.

      The buffer size should be larger than any message potentially received from this channel. If the received message exceeds the specified size, only last bs bytes will be received.

      Parameters:
      cacheSize - remnants cache size.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if cache size is zero or negative.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public BlockingSocketChannel connect(InetSocketAddress address)
      Open connection.

      If the channel can resolve specified route, the thread is blocked until the connection is established or the timeout occurs. If the route cannot be resolved, an exception is thrown.

      Closes the previous connection if there is already one.

      Parameters:
      address - server socket address.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if the provided address is null.
      BlockingSocketException - if any socket access errors occur.

    • reconnect

      public BlockingSocketChannel reconnect()
      Try to reconnect to previously connected address. Skips if connection already established.

    • isConnected

      public boolean isConnected()
      Check whether the client is connected or not.
      Returns:
      true if client connected.

    • write

      public void write(byte[] message)
      Write message to channel.

      Adds a newline character to the end if there is none.

      Parameters:
      message - byte sequence to write.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the channel has not yet connected.
      NullPointerException - if the provided message is null.
      BlockingSocketException - if any socket access errors occur.

    • read

      public List<byte[]> read()
      Read all messages received since the last read.

      Blocks until at least one byte read.

      Returns:
      list of read messages.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the channel has not yet connected.
      BlockingSocketException - if any socket access errors occur.

    • close

      public void close()
      Close the connection.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the channel has not yet connected.
      BlockingSocketException - if any socket access errors occur.

    • reader

      public BlockingSocketReader reader()
      Creates new BlockingSocketReader associated with that channel.
      Returns:
      Reader for that channel.

    • writer

      public BlockingSocketWriter writer()
      Creates new BlockingSocketWriter associated with that channel.
      Returns:
      Writer for that channel.
